title: Glasgow Modified Alcohol Withdrawal Scale (GMAWS)
description: Clinical scale used to assess and monitor the severity of alcohol withdrawal symptoms. Evaluates five clinical characteristics (tremor, sweating, hallucinations, orientation, agitation) with scores from 0-2 each, for a total score ranging from 0-10 points. Used to guide benzodiazepine treatment dosing and monitoring intervals.

parameters.description: Assessment of sweating/diaphoresis in alcohol withdrawal

parameters.description: Assessment of orientation to person, place, and time in alcohol withdrawal

parameters.description: Assessment of agitation/anxiety level in alcohol withdrawal

result.name: gmaws_total_score
result.description: Total Glasgow Modified Alcohol Withdrawal Scale score (0-10 points)

ranges.interpretation: No benzodiazepines required. Continue monitoring. Reassess in 2 hours. Provide supportive care and consider thiamine supplementation.
Mild withdrawal symptoms. Administer Diazepam 10mg PO or Lorazepam 2mg PO. Reassess in 2 hours. Monitor vital signs and provide supportive care.
Moderate to severe withdrawal requiring immediate treatment. Administer Diazepam 20mg PO or Lorazepam 4mg PO. Reassess in 1 hour. Close monitoring required.

ranges.description: Severe withdrawal symptoms with high risk of complications
ranges.interpretation: Severe withdrawal with high risk of delirium tremens. Administer Diazepam 20mg PO or Lorazepam 4mg PO. Reassess in 1 hour. Consider IV route if unable to take oral. Urgent medical evaluation if score remains ≥8 for >1 hour.

references: Sullivan JT, Sykora K, Schneiderman J, Naranjo CA, Sellers EM. Assessment of alcohol withdrawal: the revised clinical institute withdrawal assessment for alcohol scale (CIWA-Ar). Br J Addict. 1989;84(11):1353-1357.

Macleod AD, Peden NR, Pryde EA, Proctor SJ. Glasgow assessment and management of alcohol guideline: an evidence-based guideline for the assessment and management of patients with harmful alcohol use in acute medical units. QJM. 2012;105(7):649-666.
Ferguson C, O'Neill A, Hameed A, Kenny RA, O'Neill D. FAST alcohol screening and the modified Glasgow alcoholic hepatitis score in the general hospital. QJM. 2009;102(4):269-273.
formula: Total GMAWS = Tremor (0-2) + Sweating (0-2) + Hallucinations (0-2) + Orientation (0-2) + Agitation (0-2). Range: 0-10 points
notes: Part of the Glasgow Assessment and Management of Alcohol (GAMA) protocol
Should not be used in intoxicated patients - must be at least 8 hours since last drink
Patients may need to be awakened for assessment
Co-existing illness may affect the score
Used to guide benzodiazepine dosing and monitoring frequency
Urgent evaluation needed if GMAWS ≥8 persists for more than 1 hour
Should be used in conjunction with vital signs monitoring
Consider thiamine supplementation for all patients at risk of alcohol withdrawal
Modified version of the Clinical Institute Withdrawal Assessment for Alcohol-Revised (CIWA-Ar)
Validated for use in general hospital settings
Part of comprehensive alcohol withdrawal management protocol
